description: This course explores Dostoevsky's magnum opus, The Brothers Karamazov, in its literary,
historical, philosophical, and religious contexts. Acclaimed for its spiritual and psychological
depth, The Brothers Karamazov is considered by some (e.g., Einstein and Freud) to be the greatest
novel ever written. Course topics include faith, doubt, nihilism, the problem of evil, suffering,
death, God, ethics, the law, guilt, forgiveness, and the interrelation of heaven and earth, of
time and eternity. The Brothers Karamazov will be taught in English translation. Offered
fullname: Dostoevsky's The Brothers Karamazov (Taught in English)
